Please keep in mind that with any upstream change, there may also be packaging changes that need to be made. bugs.title: CVE-2018-7753 python-bleach: URI Scheme Restriction Bypass with character entities [fedora-26]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-7753 python-bleach: URI Scheme Restriction Bypass with character entities [fedora-26]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-7753 python-bleach: URI Scheme Restriction Bypass with character entities

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in python-bleach version 2.1. Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to URI Scheme Restriction Bypass. Attributes that have URI values weren't properly sanitized if the values contained character entities. Using character entities, it was possible to construct a URI value with a scheme that was not allowed that would slide through unsanitized.


References:
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=892252

Patch:
https://github.com/mozilla/bleach/commit/c5df5789ec3471a31311f42c2d19fc2cf21b35ef

Created python-bleach tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-26 [bug 1558268]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-26.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1558267,1558268

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

Fedora 26 has bleach 1.5. According to the CHANGES file[0], this problem was introduced in bleach 2.1. IMO that means we don't need to upgrade Fedora 26 for this, especially since going to 2.1.3 would be a backwards-incompatible change.

Thoughts?


[0] https://github.com/mozilla/bleach/blob/v2.1.3/CHANGES

On the other hand, Fedora 27 is affected by this, though there is an update out for it:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-e38f759144

Hi Randy!
Fedora 27 is on python-bleach version 2.1.3 which is the version in which this issue was fixed.

Regarding Fedora 26, indeed this was introduced in version 2.1 but backwards incompatibility is beyond my knowledge since I'm not involve in the package development

Fedora 27 is *almost* on 2.1.3, but it's not been stabilized yet, so stable Fedora 27 is still at 2.1. I will change this ticket to be associated with Fedora 27 since Fedora 26 is not affected and 27 is. Technically Fedora 28 is also affected, though Fedora 28 users have updates-testing enabled by default so for practical purposes it is fixed there. I will also associate those updates with this BZ.

Igor submitted the updates so I will also assign this BZ to him for credit :)

This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
Version 2.1.3 (March 5th, 2018)
-------------------------------

**Security fixes**

* Attributes that have URI values weren't properly sanitized if the
  values contained character entities. Using character entities, it
  was possible to construct a URI value with a scheme that was not
  allowed that would slide through unsanitized.

  This security issue was introduced in Bleach 2.1. Anyone using
  Bleach 2.1 is highly encouraged to upgrade.


**Backwards incompatible changes**

None

**Features**

None

**Bug fixes**

* Fixed some other edge cases for attribute URI value sanitizing and
improved testing of this code.
title: python-bleach-2.1.3-1.fc28
